item.title: 27 DDoS Attack Services Taken Down by Law Enforcement
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Law enforcement agencies in 15 countries cooperated in taking down 27 websites selling DDoS-for-hire services.

The post 27 DDoS Attack Services Taken Down by Law Enforcement appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Industry Moves for the week of December 9, 2024 - SecurityWeek
item.description: Explore industry moves and significant changes in the industry for the week of December 9, 2024. Stay updated with the latest industry trends and shifts.

item.title: Cleo Patches Exploited Flaw as Security Firms Detail Malware Pushed in Attacks
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Cleo has released patches for the exploited vulnerability and security firms have detailed the malware delivered in attacks.

The post Cleo Patches Exploited Flaw as Security Firms Detail Malware Pushed in Attacks appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Hunk Companion, WP Query Console Vulnerabilities Chained to Hack WordPress Sites
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Two vulnerabilities in the Hunk Companion and WP Query Console WordPress plugins allow attackers to backdoor websites.

The post Hunk Companion, WP Query Console Vulnerabilities Chained to Hack WordPress Sites appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Apple Pushes Major iOS, macOS Security Updates
item.dc:creator: Ryan Naraine
item.description:
Cupertino ships iOS 18.2 and macOS Sequoia 15.2 patches to fix data leakage, sandbox escapes and code exection vulnerabilities.

The post Apple Pushes Major iOS, macOS Security Updates appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: No Doughnuts Today? Cyberattack Puts Krispy Kreme in a Sticky Situation
item.dc:creator: SecurityWeek News
item.description:
The doughnut and coffeehouse chain confirmed a cyberattack took out parts of its online ordering system in parts of the United States.

The post No Doughnuts Today? Cyberattack Puts Krispy Kreme in a Sticky Situation appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: BadRAM Attack Uses $10 Equipment to Break AMD Processor Protections
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Academic researchers devise BadRAM, a new attack that uses $10 equipment to break AMD’s latest trusted execution environment protections.

The post BadRAM Attack Uses $10 Equipment to Break AMD Processor Protections appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Google Pays $55,000 for High-Severity Chrome Browser Bug
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Google pushes out major Chrome browser updates to fix multiple serious security defects.

The post Google Pays $55,000 for High-Severity Chrome Browser Bug appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Now on Demand: Inside a Hacker’s Playbook – How Cybercriminals Use Deepfakes
item.dc:creator: SecurityWeek News
item.description:
This eye-opening session that pulls back the curtain on how bad actors exploit social engineering tactics, like deepfake technology and Business Email Compromise (BEC).

The post Now on Demand: Inside a Hacker’s Playbook – How Cybercriminals Use Deepfakes appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Atlassian, Splunk Patch High-Severity Vulnerabilities
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Atlassian and Splunk on Tuesday announced patches for over two dozen vulnerabilities, including high-severity flaws.

The post Atlassian, Splunk Patch High-Severity Vulnerabilities appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Cleo Vulnerability Exploitation Linked to Termite Ransomware Group
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Exploitation of a vulnerability affecting Cleo file transfer tools has been linked to the new Termite ransomware group.

The post Cleo Vulnerability Exploitation Linked to Termite Ransomware Group appeared first on SecurityWeek.
